It's kind of amazing to me how bad Docker actually is and yet no one has built a compelling alternative

Clean energy transition pathways: solar and wind are our best bets, supplemented by replacing natural gas with P2X (power-to-X e.g. power-to-hydrogen + CCGT)

@bp256r1 @sundhaug92 There are various OCI-compatible tools that don't solve my immediate problems

@bp256r1 @sundhaug92 I'm just a bitter long-time real-world user who thinks Docker plateaued and hit a local maximum sometime around 2016 and for all my hopes "OCI" would make the situation better things just kinda crystalized in-place and expecting anything better at this point is a fool's errand
@bp256r1 @sundhaug92 If all you want are cgroups, they can be managed via systemd using `$ systemctl set-property`
@bp256r1 @HashiCorp Docker is like if there is one programming language and it doesn’t have a type system

@ELkeyboards @dorfman_p @sudgut Wind worldwide has an installed capacity of 824.87GW which produced 1,861 TWh in 2021.

Add in 1,000 TWh of solar and we get 2,861 TWh for solar+wind, which beats nuclear's 2,653 TWh in 2021.

The gap is only set to further widen from here.

Also it should probably return value(s) and do lazy evaluation of any intermediate results.

You are still too much of a moron to tell a verb from a noun.

"Solar peak at diurnally opposite times" would be grammatically incorrect.

What a fucking moron you are 🙄
@QuantumCopy @cabkol @HugoSAS Do you know the difference between a noun and a verb, or that (s) in that context means optional? Apparently not.

@QuantumCopy @cabkol @HugoSAS "There are no daily solar peak(s)." 🙄

@einstein_4ever @cabkol @HugoSAS Plants were initially taken offline for the corrosion issue in December 2021. We’re coming up on a year fairly soon.
https://t.co/ywF8Rnl4T0

@einstein_4ever @cabkol @HugoSAS The nuclear power cult desperately wants to invent a maintenance problem to politicize the issue, rather than admit this was a technological flaw and that these flaws can result in nearly a year of downtime

@einstein_4ever @cabkol @HugoSAS Nice argument from hindsight. Let's say they caught the issue sooner... what would that have accomplished?

It's a design/construction flaw. The massive corrosion-related outage would have just happened at a different time, it wouldn't have prevented it.

@einstein_4ever @cabkol @HugoSAS No, you’re repeating misinformation.

The corrosion issue which is the main cause of the widespread nuclear outage in France is the result of a design flaw and shoddy welding at construction time.
@einstein_4ever @cabkol @HugoSAS Nobody’s talking about using it in cars
